Display: Do you know your family’s medical history? Please think only of those family members you are related to by blood.

Please indicate which family members, if any, have ever been diagnosed with the following health conditions and/or health events. Think only of those people you are related to by blood. (select all that apply)
Has anyone in your immediate family ever been diagnosed with any other health conditions?
Sibling(s) [people with the same mother and/or father as you]
Head and neck (This includes cancers of the mouth, sinuses, nose, or throat. This does not include brain cancer.)

Atrial fibrillation (or a-fib) or atrial flutter (or a-flutter). (These conditions cause irregular, often fast, heart beats that can cause poor blood flow. A-fib and a-flutter are not the same as a heart murmur.)
Pulmonary embolism or deep vein thrombosis (DVT)
Anemia (low number of red blood cells)
Sickle cell disease, sickle cell trait, thalassemia
Other/unknown diabetes (This includes gestational diabetes (diabetes during pregnancy) and borderline diabetes (pre-diabetes).)
Type 1 diabetes (Type 1 diabetics do not produce enough insulin on their own, so they have get insulin injections. Type 1 diabetes used to be called juvenile onset diabetes.)
Type 2 diabetes (Type 1 diabetics do not produce enough insulin on their own, so they have get insulin injections. Type 1 diabetes used to be called juvenile onset diabetes.)
Chronic lung disease (COPD, emphysema or bronchitis)
